page.title: 07Wells Hall Primary School
page.content: Mr Gooden is the school caretaker he has been here seventeen years just before the school opened in 1968. In April 1966 the infants opened. In September 1963 the Juniors opened. First of all it was 5-11 years old. In 1974 it became one of the first schools to start doing 5-9 years old. When the school opened there were 16 teachers including the headmaster Mr Blakey. Now there are 12 teachers including headmaster Mr Darby. In 1968 there were about 550 children in the school with about 40 children in each class. Now there are about 295 children and about 30 in each class. There is a swimming pool. Swimming is taught by Mrs Cotton during the summer term only. The children start school at 9am and end at 12 noon for lunch. At 1.30pm they start again until 3.30pm.
